title: All change: Does the deluge of FTSE bosses departing signal trouble ahead?
text:
Whenever a company boss departs, it feels personal. Whether they go out on a high or are axed by a furious board, any FTSE chief’s exit is inevitably seen through the simple prism of their own success or failure.

But this week’s departures by Dave Lewis from Tesco and Alison Cooper of Imperial Brands carry a broader significance.

They feed into a wider exodus of FTSE 100 bosses since January 2018 that hints at the broader difficulties facing the economy - and the huge pressure on bosses of London-listed blue-chips.

A total of 17 FTSE 100 chiefs have been replaced or have announced their departures this year, according to figures from AJ Bell. That’s considerably higher than the 12.2 average...
